Created by katch, last modified on Sep 11, 2018

**Use Case Videos**
confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-note > > >
> > The Use Case videso below use Unravel 4.2 > >
**[Case \#1: How to Search for Applications and Optimize/Tune a Hive Application](https://unraveldata.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/UN42/pages/53649719/Getting+Started#GettingStarted-4.2-Case1)** **[Case \#2: How to "Root Cause" Issues with a Workflow that Missed Its SLA](https://unraveldata.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/UN42/pages/53649719/Getting+Started#GettingStarted-4.2-Case2)** **[Case \#3: How to Debug Failed Applications](https://unraveldata.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/UN42/pages/53649719/Getting+Started#GettingStarted-4.2-Case3)** **[Case \#4: How to Review Spark Applications and Identify Areas for Performance Improvements](https://unraveldata.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/UN42/pages/53649719/Getting+Started#GettingStarted-4.2-Case4)** **Running the Configuration Wizard** After you install the Unravel Server RPM, you can run Unravel Web UI's configuration wizard to: - Set up access to various Big Data components (HDFS, Hive, Oozie, and so on). - Create users - Set up email/SMTP, LDAP, Kerberos The configuration wizard informs you of errors and continuously checks for failed and incorrect settings. To start the configuration wizard, click **Admin** | **Manage** | **Configuration**.
confluence-information-macro confluence-information-macro-note > > >
> > The Unravel Web UI configuration wizard is available only for the > `admin` user. > >
**Setting Up Access to Big Data Components** **Creating Users and Setting Up Email/SMTP, LDAP, Kerberos**
